Key Match Events: Dorian Finney-Smith delivered two bombs from deep in the fourth quarter to take a 104-101 advantage with 60 seconds to play.
Santi Aldama airballed the would-be game-winner and handing the Nets their second victory over Memphis in five days.
Ben Simmons' absence began to hurt Brooklyn.
Zach Edey appeared well on his way to the best performance of his young career, posting six points and five rebounds.
Finney-Smith caught fire himself, though, connecting on all three of his attempts from deep in the third and all but neutralizing Edey's output.
Post-Match Reflections: The Nets are back to.500 and hold third place in the Eastern Conference.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The matchup begins a three-game road trip for the Nets, who take on the Cleveland Cavaliers on Nov. 9 and New Orleans Pelicans on Nov. 11.
The teams continued to trade baskets as Brooklyn orchestrated a 7-0 run late in the first stanza.
Others: Jalen Wilson, Ja Morant, and Nic Claxton also contributed to the game.
